content.question: The <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-components of an acceleration vector are given by the equations <math alttext="a sub x equals, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math> and <math alttext="a sub y equals, open parenthesis, 4 t minus 5, close parenthesis, meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time in seconds. What is the magnitude of the acceleration vector at <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="4 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="5 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>
<math alttext="7 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><msup><mtext> m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
